poem:
Title: Catalonia and Her Song

In Catalonia's stone heart, beats the drum,
Of voices, wild, gathered at dawn's call. 
A vote cast in a pool of dawn's gold,
For hope or quietude, history's pen holds.
Sánchez watches, his plans tightly drawn,
With stoic Aragonès in the morn.
Details notched in the olives' silver vein,
Scribing Catalonia's undying refrain.

The election was called in March by the Catalan president, Pere Aragonès, a member of the moderate pro-independence". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
